trans-unit.source: Step 5(c): Generate Schema for the Insert Operation
trans-unit.target: Step 5(c): Generate Schema for the Insert Operation

trans-unit.source: So far, we have the schema for the flat-file message, the FTP source that represents the FTP Server, and the <token>lobrelay</token> and <token>lobtarget</token> for connectivity to the on-premise SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: So far, we have the schema for the flat-file message, the FTP source that represents the FTP Server, and the <token>lobrelay</token> and <token>lobtarget</token> for connectivity to the on-premise SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: But we still require the schema of the message required to perform an <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the on-premise SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: But we still require the schema of the message required to perform an <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the on-premise SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: This step demonstrates how to generate that schema.
trans-unit.target: This step demonstrates how to generate that schema.

trans-unit.source: To generate the schema for Insert operation
trans-unit.target: To generate the schema for Insert operation

trans-unit.source: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, in the <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right click the LOB target you created, and then click <embeddedLabel>AddSchemasToFlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, in the <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right click the LOB target you created, and then click <embeddedLabel>AddSchemasToFlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the file name prefix to <userInput>FlatFile_Bridge_</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set the file name prefix to <userInput>FlatFile_Bridge_</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Leave the folder name to its default value of <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Leave the folder name to its default value of <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select credential Type as <embeddedLabel>Windows</embeddedLabel> to use Windows authentication to connect to SQL Server, and then click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select credential Type as <embeddedLabel>Windows</embeddedLabel> to use Windows authentication to connect to SQL Server, and then click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The schemas are added to the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> project under the <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel> folder.
trans-unit.target: The schemas are added to the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> project under the <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel> folder.

trans-unit.source: The schema that corresponds to the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table has the name <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge_TableOperation.dbo.Claims.xsd</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The schema that corresponds to the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table has the name <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge_TableOperation.dbo.Claims.xsd</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The structure of the schema resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The structure of the schema resembles the following:
